speaker: ORLANDO
text: Is ’t possible that on so little acquaintance

speaker: ORLANDO
text: you should like her? That, but seeing, you should

speaker: ORLANDO
text: love her? And loving, woo? And wooing, she should

speaker: ORLANDO
text: grant? And will you persever to enjoy her?

speaker: OLIVER
text: Neither call the giddiness of it in question, the

speaker: OLIVER
text: poverty of her, the small acquaintance, my sudden

speaker: OLIVER
text: wooing, nor her sudden consenting, but say with

speaker: OLIVER
text: me “I love Aliena”; say with her that she loves me;

speaker: OLIVER
text: consent with both that we may enjoy each other. It

speaker: OLIVER
text: shall be to your good, for my father’s house and all

speaker: OLIVER
text: the revenue that was old Sir Rowland’s will I estate

speaker: OLIVER
text: upon you, and here live and die a shepherd.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: You have my consent. Let your wedding be

speaker: ORLANDO
text: tomorrow. Thither will I invite the Duke and all ’s

speaker: ORLANDO
text: contented followers. Go you and prepare Aliena,

speaker: ORLANDO
text: for, look you, here comes my Rosalind.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: God save you,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: brother.

speaker: OLIVER
text: And you, fair sister.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: O my dear Orlando, how it

speaker: ROSALIND
text: grieves me to see thee wear thy heart in a scarf.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: It is my arm.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: I thought thy heart had been

speaker: ROSALIND
text: wounded with the claws of a lion.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Wounded it is, but with the eyes of a lady.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Did your brother tell you

speaker: ROSALIND
text: how I counterfeited to swoon when he showed me

speaker: ROSALIND
text: your handkercher?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Ay, and greater wonders than that.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: O, I know where you are.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Nay, ’tis true. There was never anything so sudden

speaker: ROSALIND
text: but the fight of two rams, and Caesar’s thrasonical

speaker: ROSALIND
text: brag of “I came, saw, and overcame.” For your

speaker: ROSALIND
text: brother and my sister no sooner met but they

speaker: ROSALIND
text: looked, no sooner looked but they loved, no sooner

speaker: ROSALIND
text: loved but they sighed, no sooner sighed but they

speaker: ROSALIND
text: asked one another the reason, no sooner knew the

speaker: ROSALIND
text: reason but they sought the remedy; and in these

speaker: ROSALIND
text: degrees have they made a pair of stairs to marriage,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: which they will climb incontinent, or else be incontinent

speaker: ROSALIND
text: before marriage. They are in the very wrath

speaker: ROSALIND
text: of love, and they will together. Clubs cannot part

speaker: ROSALIND
text: them.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: They shall be married tomorrow, and I will

speaker: ORLANDO
text: bid the Duke to the nuptial. But O, how bitter a

speaker: ORLANDO
text: thing it is to look into happiness through another

speaker: ORLANDO
text: man’s eyes. By so much the more shall I tomorrow

speaker: ORLANDO
text: be at the height of heart-heaviness by how much I

speaker: ORLANDO
text: shall think my brother happy in having what he

speaker: ORLANDO
text: wishes for.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Why, then, tomorrow I cannot

speaker: ROSALIND
text: serve your turn for Rosalind?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I can live no longer by thinking.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: I will weary you then no

speaker: ROSALIND
text: longer with idle talking. Know of me then—for

speaker: ROSALIND
text: now I speak to some purpose—that I know you are

speaker: ROSALIND
text: a gentleman of good conceit. I speak not this that

speaker: ROSALIND
text: you should bear a good opinion of my knowledge,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: insomuch I say I know you are. Neither do I labor

speaker: ROSALIND
text: for a greater esteem than may in some little measure

speaker: ROSALIND
text: draw a belief from you to do yourself good, and

speaker: ROSALIND
text: not to grace me. Believe then, if you please, that I

speaker: ROSALIND
text: can do strange things. I have, since I was three year

speaker: ROSALIND
text: old, conversed with a magician, most profound in

speaker: ROSALIND
text: his art and yet not damnable. If you do love Rosalind

speaker: ROSALIND
text: so near the heart as your gesture cries it out,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: when your brother marries Aliena shall you marry

speaker: ROSALIND
text: her. I know into what straits of fortune she is

speaker: ROSALIND
text: driven, and it is not impossible to me, if it appear

speaker: ROSALIND
text: not inconvenient to you, to set her before your eyes

speaker: ROSALIND
text: tomorrow, human as she is, and without any

speaker: ROSALIND
text: danger.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Speak’st thou in sober meanings?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: By my life I do, which I

speaker: ROSALIND
text: tender dearly, though I say I am a magician. Therefore

speaker: ROSALIND
text: put you in your best array, bid your friends; for

speaker: ROSALIND
text: if you will be married tomorrow, you shall, and to

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Rosalind, if you will.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Look, here comes a lover of mine and a lover of

speaker: ROSALIND
text: hers.

If

If

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Why do you speak too,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: “Why blame you me to love you?”

speaker: ORLANDO
text: To her that is not here, nor doth not hear.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Pray you, no more of this.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: ’Tis like the howling of Irish wolves against the

speaker: ROSALIND
text:
moon.
                 
                (
                To
                 
                Silvius
                .
                )
               I will help you if I can.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: I would love you if I could.—Tomorrow

speaker: ROSALIND
text:
meet me all together.
                 
                (

                .

speaker: ROSALIND
text: you if ever I marry woman, and I’ll be married

speaker: ROSALIND

tomorrow.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: satisfy man, and you shall be married tomorrow.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: contents you, and you shall be married tomorrow.

               As you love Rosalind, meet.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: As you love Phoebe, meet.—And as I love

speaker: ROSALIND
text: no woman, I’ll meet. So fare you well. I have left

speaker: ROSALIND
text: you commands.

speaker: SILVIUS
text: I’ll not fail, if I live.

speaker: PHOEBE
text: Nor I.

speaker: ORLANDO
